bug.short_desc: qx.Mobile widget does not receive "transitionEnd" event

long_desc.thetext:
Have a look at this example:
http://tinyurl.com/ps8hchp
If you use "addListener()" for receiving the "transitionEnd" event, the applied function is never called.
If you use qx.bom.Element.addListener and pass the widget's dom node, everything works fine.

I already did some investigations on that issue. The Transition event handler is only suitable for DOM nodes which is the way it should be. In the case of qx.Desktop, where the listening to the transitionEnd works, the qx.ui.core.EventHandler takes care of converting the desktop widget to dom nodes for the event layer. This layer is missing for the mobile part of the framework which leads to the fact that the transition handler never gets registered and thus, the callback is never called.
